title: WCAS LEGAL_ST 376-0-21 Topics in Legal Studies

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course examines how individuals' social position permeated their interactions with others and with the law in the United States before the Civil War. In the process, we'll examine how the law reinforced class, gender, and racial boundaries in order to maintain the social and economic status quo.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will analyze and compare the arguments of secondary sources, and evaluate them in light of primary source evidence. Students will construct original historical arguments using primary and secondary sources as evidence.
